![Ganghwa Anglican Church (ÎåÄÌïúÏÑ±Í≥µÌöå Í∞ïÌôîÏÑ±Îãπ)](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579082_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Ganghwa Anglican Church was consecrated in 1900 by Charies Jone Corfe, the First Bishop of the Church as the St. Peter and St.Paul‚Äôs Church. The church has since undergone several restorations, but the design remains true to the original.

The two-story 4x10 rectangular building is characterized by traditional Korean construction style on the outside while the interior is a Western Basilica style symbolizing the beauty of harmony and Korean tradition. It was first designated as Gyeonggi-do Tangible Cultural Property No. 154 and then became Incheon Tangible Cultural property when Ganghwa was included in Incheon Metropolitan City. In January 2001 it was designated as Historic Site No.424 of Korea. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-32-930-4571| ## Detail Image ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579081_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579081_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579084_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579084_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579085_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579085_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579086_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/1579086_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512660_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512660_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512661_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512661_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512663_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512663_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512665_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512665_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512666_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512666_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512662_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-10-1660121005670/2512662_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-32-930-4571](tel:+82329304571) - [üè†www.cha.go.kr](http://www.cha.go.kr/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.7496574902 longitude: 126.4856636932 title: 10, Gwancheong-gil 27beon-gil, Ganghwa-gun, Incheon ``` ## Directions 1) Sinchon Station (Seoul Subway Line 2), Exit 4.
Go straight 260m to arrive at the bus stop in front of Artreon. From the bus stop, take Bus 3000 to Ganghwa Bus Terminal. Transfer to Bus 88 and get off at Suhyup Bus Stop. (2 bus stops)

2) Yeongdeungpo Station (Seoul Subway Line 1)
Across from Shinsegae Department Store, take Bus 88 and get off at Suhyup Bus Stop.

From the Suhyup Bus Stop, continue walking straight for 400m and take a right at Ganghwa Jungang Market.
Walk for 130m and the church will be on the left.

data.title: Ganghwa Anglican Church (ÎåÄÌïúÏÑ±Í≥µÌöå Í∞ïÌôîÏÑ±Îãπ)
data.description:
Ganghwa Anglican Church was consecrated in 1900 by Charies Jone Corfe, the First Bishop of the Church as the St. Peter and St.Paul‚Äôs Church. The church has since undergone several restorations, but the design remains true to the original.

The two-story 4x10 rectangular building is characterized by traditional Korean construction style on the outside while the interior is a Western Basilica style symbolizing the beauty of harmony and Korean tradition. It was first designated as Gyeonggi-do Tangible Cultural Property No. 154 and then became Incheon Tangible Cultural property when Ganghwa was included in Incheon Metropolitan City. In January 2001 it was designated as Historic Site No.424 of Korea.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Sugi Beach (ÏàòÍ∏∞Ìï¥Î≥Ä)
dataList.description:
Located on Sido Island in Incheon, Sugi Beach is easily accessible from Seoul. Sido Island is situated between Yeongjongdo Island and Ganghwado Island. The beach is not as crowded as other famous beaches, and is ideal for families or campers.

Sugi Beach was the filming location for the famous drama series Full House (2004). Sido Island connects Sindo Island and Modo Island, making it easy to tour the three islands by foot or car.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Seopori Beach (ÏÑúÌè¨Î¶¨Ìï¥Î≥Ä)
dataList.description: Seopori Beach, designated as a national tourism area, is surrounded by a luxurious forest of 100-year-old pine trees. The moderately sloped, white sand beach extends 3 kilometers in length and 300 meters in x_width. The beach and the pine tree forest provide a great recreational area for the 100,000 annual visitors. Leisure facilities include a vast sports field, seaside playground, tennis court, restaurants, karaoke, bicycle rentals, and more. Visitors can enjoy fishing from the rocks on the seashore, swimming in the clean sea, and strolling through the pine  forest to appreciate the scenic surroundings.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Seonsu Port (Hupohang Port) (ÌõÑÌè¨Ìï≠ ÏÑ†ÏàòÌè¨Íµ¨)
dataList.description:
Seonsu Port, officially named Hupohang Port, is the largest port on Ganghwado Island, located near Dongmak Beach. Fishing boats anchored here often travel to and from waters near Seongmodo Island, known as a fishery of large-eyed herring. Visitors will find several hoe (sliced raw fish) restaurants along the port, serving hoe prepared with freshly caught seafood.

The seaside destination is close to many nearby attractions including Jeondeungsa Temple, Dongmak Beach, and a scenic drive along the coast of Ganghwado Island. The port is also known for romantic sunsets which are best enjoyed when viewed from between the port and Dongmak Beach.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Seonjaedo Island (ÏÑ†Ïû¨ÎèÑ)
dataList.description: Seonjaedo Island in Incheon is believed to have been settled since the Neolithic Era. It had been called Sowudo Island during the Goryeo and Joseon dynasties, before it was named Seonjaedo in 1871. The name Seonjaedo means an island where a divine fairy came down and danced. At low tide, a sandbar path connecting the island with the mainland appears from the ocean. Seonjaedo Island is also a bridge island that connects Daebudo and Yeongheungdo Islands.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Muuido Island (Î¨¥ÏùòÎèÑ)
dataList.description:
Muuido Island is located in Jung-gu, Incheon which is not far from the mainland. Until the completion of Muui Bridge in 2019, the island was accessible only by ferry. Nearby are two smaller islands, Silmido Island and Somuuido Island. In the past, small boats were used to go from Muuido Island to Somuuido Island but the two islands are currently connected by a bridge so visitors can reach Somuuido after a 10-15 minute walk.

Muuido Village Bus takes people from Keunmuri Ferry Dock to Gwangmyeonghang Port. To enjoy the beauty of Somuuido Island fully, Muuibadanuri-gil 8 Course is a must-visit path, taking around 1 hour and giving stunning views of the West Sea vista.

Muuido has two famous beaches, namely Hanagae Beach and Silmi Beach. One interesting thing in Silmi Beach is that people can walk to Silmido Island at low tide. Hiking up Horyonggoksan Mountain and Guksabong Peak is also available from Hanagae Beach.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Jeokseoksa Temple (Ï†ÅÏÑùÏÇ¨)
dataList.description:
Jeokseoksa Temple is a traditional Buddhist temple that was founded around 1,600 years ago. It is known for Gamnojeong, which is the water trickling out from the rock crevices on the east side of Daeungjeon Hall (main temple building). While the water is cool and sweet, legend has it that it dries up or turns murky in times of national crisis. According to the records, Palman Daejanggyeong (Tripitaka Koreana printing woodblocks) used to be kept in Jeokseoksa before they were moved to Baengnyeongsa Temple, then to Jeondeungsa Temple, and finally to Haeinsa Temple.

Jeokseoksa Temple is connected to Nakjodae Observatory, which offers a magnificent view of the sun setting over the West Sea. In fact, the view is so magnificent that it is admired as one of the 10 best sceneries of Ganghwado Island.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Incheon International Airport Terminal 2
dataList.description:
Since opening in 2001, Incheon International Airport has been rated as the best airport in the world numerous times. And to further improve, the Terminal 2 officially opened in 2018 after nine years of construction. Terminal 2 was desigend with the concept of an artport, a portmanteau of art and airport, to serve as a space for entertainment in addition to an international tansportation hub.

With self-checking counters and smart counter that automatically checks in luggage for the convenience of passengers, the aiport implements high-tech services to better provide information and strengthen security. The airport has also upgraded their check-in system so that passengers can enjoy all the cultural space and attractions the airport has to offer
dataList.author: korea-tour
